intro: Tabebuia trinitensis, commonly known as the Trinitarian Trumpet Tree, is a flowering tree native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a dense, spreading canopy. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, with a smooth texture. The bark is often fissured and has a distinctive light-colored appearance.
